metadata.title: CVE-2022-1198 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
A use-after-free vulnerabilitity was discovered indrivers/net/hamradio/6pack.c of linux that allows an attacker to crashlinux kernel by simulating ax25 device using 6pack driver from user space.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1198` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1146-azure - 4.15.0-1146.161~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1146.161~14.04.1').
